Informative.desc: Show this message, or help for a specific command
Show the full version of fastfetch
List search paths of config files
List search paths of presets and logos
List the supported features fastfetch was compiled with

Config.desc: Specify the config file or preset to be loaded
Config.remark: The file will be searched in the order of "fastfetch --list-config-paths". If "none", disable further config loading. See also https://github.com/fastfetch-cli/fastfetch/wiki/Configuration for more info

Config.desc: Generate a config file to specified path with options specified in the command line (if any)
Config.remark: Defaults to "~/.config/fastfetch/config.jsonc". Will Print the generated config if <path> is "-"

Config.desc: Generate a config file to specified path. Overwrite the existing one

General.desc: Use separate threads to send HTTP requests
On Bedrock Linux, whether to escape the bedrock jail
Set the timeout (ms) for WMI queries
Set the timeout (ms) when waiting for child processes
Set if only DRM should be used to detect displays
remark: Use this option if you encountered problems with other detection method.

enum.true: Try `libdrm` first, then `sysfs` if libdrm failed

Logo.desc: Set the logo source
Logo.remark: Should be the name of a builtin logo, or a path to an image file. See also https://github.com/fastfetch-cli/fastfetch/wiki/Logo-options

Logo.desc: Set the type of the logo given in "--logo"

enum.auto: If something is given, first try builtin, then file. Otherwise detect logo
enum.file: Text file, printed with color code replacement
enum.data: Text data, printed with color code replacement
enum.sixel: Image file, printed as sixel codes
enum.kitty: Image file, printed as kitty graphics protocol
enum.kitty_direct: Image file, tell the terminal emulator to read image data from the specified file (Supported by kitty and wezterm)
enum.iterm: Image file, printed as iterm graphics protocol
enum.chafa: Image file, printed as ascii art using libchafa
enum.raw: Image file, printed as raw binary string

Logo.desc: Set the width of the logo (in characters), if it is an image
Set the height of the logo (in characters), if it is an image
Set if the logo should fill the specified width and height as much as possible without stretching
Logo.remark: Supported by iTerm image protocol only

Logo.desc: Overwrite a color in the logo
Logo.remark: See `-h color` for the list of available colors

Logo.desc: Set the padding on the left and the right of the logo
Set the padding on the left of the logo
Set the padding on the right of the logo
Set the padding on the top of the logo
Whether to print the remaining logo, if it has more lines than modules to display
If true, print modules at bottom of the logo
If true, regenerate image logo cache
Short for --logo-type file --logo <path>
Short for --logo-type file-raw --logo <path>
Short for --logo-type data --logo <data>
Short for --logo-type data-raw --logo <data>
Short for --logo-type raw --logo <path>
Short for --logo-type sixel --logo <path>
Short for --logo-type kitty --logo <path>
Short for --logo-type kitty-direct --logo <path>
Short for --logo-type iterm --logo <path>
Short for --logo-type chafa --logo <path>
Produce character-cell output using foreground colors only
Specify character symbols to employ in final output
Determine how colors are used in the output
Logo.remark: This value maps the int value of enum ChafaCanvasMode. See chafa document for detail

enum.INDEXED_240: 256 colors, but avoid using the lower 16 whose values vary between terminal environments
enum.INDEXED_16: 16 colors using the aixterm ANSI extension
enum.FGBG_BGFG: Default foreground and background colors, plus inversion
enum.FGBG: Default foreground and background colors. No ANSI codes will be used
enum.INDEXED_8: 8 colors, compatible with original ANSI X3.64
enum.INDEXED_16_8: 16 FG colors (8 of which enabled with bold/bright) and 8 BG colors

Logo.desc: Set color space used for quantization
Logo.remark: This value maps the int value of enum ChafaColorSpace. See chafa document for detail

enum.RGB: RGB color space. Fast but imprecise
enum.DIN99D: DIN99d color space. Slower, but good perceptual color precision

Logo.desc: Set output dither mode (No effect with 24-bit color)
Logo.remark: This value maps the int value of enum ChafaDitherMode. See chafa document for detail

Display.desc: Set the structure of the fetch
Display.remark: Must be a colon separated list of keys. Use "fastfetch --list-modules" to see the ones available

Display.desc: Show time usage (in ms) for individual modules
Disable logo and all escape sequences
Set the color of the keys
Display.remark: Doesn't affect module Title, Separator and Colors. See `-h color` for the list of available colors

Display.desc: Set the color of the title
Display.remark: See `-h color` for the list of available colors

Display.desc: Set the color of module output
Display.remark: See `-h color` for the list of available colors

Display.desc: Set the color of both the keys and title
Align the width of keys to <num> characters
Set if the keys, title and ASCII logo should be printed in bright color
Set the separator between key and value
Print occurring errors
Whether to disable line wrap during the run
Whether to hide the cursor during the run
Set the binary prefix to used
Set the percentage output type
Set the number of digits to keep after the decimal point when formatting percentage numbers
Set color used in green state of percentage bars and numbers
Display.remark: See `-h color` for the list of available colors

Display.desc: Set color used in yellow state of percentage bars and numbers
Display.remark: See `-h color` for the list of available colors

Display.desc: Set color used in red state of percentage bars and numbers
Display.remark: See `-h color` for the list of available colors

Display.desc: Set the character to use in elapsed part of percentage bars
Set the character to use in total part of percentage bars
Set the width of percentage bars, in number of characters
Whether to show a border around percentage bars
Set if the stdout application buffer should be disabled
Set the number of digits to keep after the decimal point when formatting sizes
Set the largest binary prefix to use when formatting sizes
Set the unit of the temperature
Set the number of digits to keep after the decimal point when printing temperature
Set color used in green state of temperature values
Display.remark: See `-h color` for the list of available colors

Display.desc: Set color used in yellow state of temperature values
Display.remark: See `-h color` for the list of available colors

Display.desc: Set color used in red state of temperature values
Display.remark: See `-h color` for the list of available colors

Display.desc: Whether to detect and display the version of terminal and shell

Library path.desc: Pciutils. Used for GPU output
Vulkan module & fallback for GPU output
Better display performance and output in wayland sessions
X11 sessions for better display detection and faster WM detection
X11 sessions for better display detection and faster WM detection
X11 sessions for better display detection and faster WM detection
X11 sessions for better display detection and faster WM detection
Used for fast resolution and refresh rate detection
Needed for values that are only stored GSettings
Needed for values that are only stored in DConf + Fallback for GSettings
Bluetooth, Player & Media detection
Needed for XFWM theme and XFCE Terminal font
Needed for pkg & rpm package count
Slower fallback for rpm package count
Images in terminal using sixel or kitty graphics protocol
Libz. Faster image output when using kitty graphics protocol
Image output as ascii art
Needed by the OpenGL module for gl context creation
Needed by the OpenGL module for gl context creation
Needed by the OpenGL module for gl context creation
OpenCL module
Pulseaudio. Used for Sound detection
NetworkManager. Used for Wifi detection
Used for Termux font detection
Used for brightness detection of external displays

Module specific.desc: Set if the title should use fully qualified domain name
Set color of the user name (left part)
Module specific.remark: See `-h color` for the list of available colors

Module specific.desc: Set color of the @ symbol (middle part)
Module specific.remark: See `-h color` for the list of available colors

Module specific.desc: Set color of the host name (right part)
Module specific.remark: See `-h color` for the list of available colors

Module specific.desc: Set the string printed by the separator module
Set the color of the separator module
A colon (semicolon on Windows) separated list of folder paths to be detected
Module specific.remark: On Windows, a drive latter must be upper cased and end with "\". "/" is used as an alias of the system drive. This option overrides other disk-show-* options

Module specific.desc: Set if regular volume should be printed
Set if external volume should be printed
Set if hidden volumes should be printed
Set if subvolumes should be printed
Set if read only volumes should be printed
Set if unknown (unable to detect sizes) volumes should be printed
Use f_bavail (lpFreeBytesAvailableToCaller for Windows) instead of f_bfree to calculate used bytes
Module specific.remark: Maybe required for macOS to print correct results

Module specific.desc: Detect total bytes instead of current rate
Show disks with given name prefix only
Show disks with given name prefix only
Detect and display SSD temperature if supported
Set if disconnected bluetooth devices should be printed
A colon separated list of package managers to be disabled when detecting
remark: Some detection methods can be very slow.
You may need to increase value of '--processing-timeout' to make it actually work.

Module specific.desc: Set if all displays should be printed in one line

enum.original-with-refresh-rate: Print original resolutions with refresh rate
enum.scaled-with-refresh-rate: Print scaled resolutions with refresh rate

Module specific.desc: Set if decimal refresh rates should not be rounded into integers when printing
Set the order should be used when printing displays
Set the sleep times (in ms) when sending DDC/CI requests
Set what type of sound devices should be printed
Set if "SetupAPI" should be used on Windows to detect battery info
remark: SetupAPI supports multi batteries, but slower.

Module specific.desc: Detect and display CPU temperature if supported
Set the number of digits to keep after the decimal point when printing CPU frequency
Display CPU usage per CPU logical core, instead of an average result
Set if DE version should be detected with slow operations
remark: It's only used as a fallback method. Please file a bug report if you encounter any issues.

Module specific.desc: Detect and display GPU temperature if supported
Use driver specific method to detect more detailed GPU information (memory usage, core count, etc)
remark: Correctly NVML (NVIDIA) and IGCL (Intel, Windows only) are supported.
Both require the latest proprietary driver to be installed.

Module specific.desc: Force using vulkan to detect GPUs
Module specific.remark: Vulkan supports video memory usage detection

Module specific.desc: Specify the type of GPUs should not be printed
Detect and display Battery temperature if supported
Set the number of digits to keep after the decimal point when printing load average
Show IPv4 addresses in local ip module
Show IPv6 addresses in local ip module
Show mac addresses in local ip module
Show loop back addresses (127.0.0.1) in local ip module
Show network prefix length (/N) in local ip module
Show interfaces with given interface name prefix only
Show the interface that is used for default routing only
Show all IPs bound to the same interface. By default only the first IP is shown
Show all IPs in one line
Show interfaces with given name prefix only
Show the interfac that is used for default routing only
Detect total bytes instead of current rate
Time in milliseconds to wait for the public ip server to respond
The URL of public IP detection server to be used
Whether to use IPv6 for public IP detection server
Set the location to be used
Module specific.remark: Must be URI encoded (e.g. a whitespace must be encoded as "+")

Module specific.desc: Time in milliseconds to wait for the weather server to respond
The output weather format to be used
Set if window manager plugin should be detected on supported platforms
The name of the player to use for module Media and Player
Set the OpenGL context creation library to use
Set the shell program to execute the command text
Set the module key to display
Set the command text to be executed
Set the symbol to be printed by Colors module
Set the number of white spaces to print before the symbol
Set the block width in spaces
Set the start range of colors in the blocks to print
remark: Display colors 0-15 in the blocks. (16 colors)
Display colors 0-7 in the blocks. (8 colors)

Module specific.desc: Set the end range of colors in the blocks to print
remark: Display colors 0-15 in the blocks. (16 colors)
Display colors 0-7 in the blocks. (8 colors)

desc: Set the format string to use for each specific module
To see how a format string works, use "fastfetch -h format".
To see help about a specific format string, use "fastfetch -h <module>-format"
Set the key to use for each specific module.
For modules which print multiple lines, the string is parsed
as a format string with the index as first character

General module.desc: Override the global "--color-keys" option for each specific module
Override the global "--color-output" option for each specific module
Override the global "--key-width" option for each specific module

desc: Value less then percent-green will be shown in green
Value greater than percent-green and less then yellow will be shown in yellow
Value greater than percent-yellow will be shown in red
Value less then temp-green will be shown in green
Value greater than temp-green and less then yellow will be shown in yellow
Value greater than temp-yellow will be shown in red
